metadata.title: CVE-2024-11706 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference may have inadvertently occurred in `pk12util`,and specifically in the `SEC_ASN1DecodeItem_Util` function, when handlingmalformed or improperly formatted input files. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 133 and Thunderbird < 133.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-11706` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 133.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 133.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 133.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '133.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
